Player History
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Earned first career win on 6/4/1986...
Traded from Atlanta to Los Angeles on 6/24/1987 (Going to LAD: P Zane Smith, P Paul Assenmacher, 2B Julio Franco. Going to ATL: P Ramon Martinez, P Paul Abbott, P Shawn Hillegas, P Chris Hammon
d)...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $771,429 through salary arbitration...
Was claimed off waivers by Toronto on 6/15/1988.
Traded from Toronto to Los Angeles on 6/16/1988 (Going to LAD: P Paul Assenmacher, P Mike Erb. Going to TOR: P Joe Beckwith)...
Had first career hit on 7/26/1988, off Dennis Rasmussen (PHI)...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1988...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $771,429 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Los Angeles to Chicago on 6/18/1989 (Going to LAD: P Turk Wendell, SS Pat Listach. Going to CHC: P Paul Assenmacher, P Jim Corsi)...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $771,429 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Chicago to Seattle on 7/27/1990 (Going to CHC: P Mike Schooler. Going to SEA: P Paul Miller, P Tim Wakefield, P Paul Assenmacher, P Antonio Alfonseca)...
8/3/1990: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $1,500,000 per year, for 2 years.
